japanese: 一位はアメリカ人でした

english: I'm the weakest person in the world
englishlit: I, world in, the first weak

grammar: Infinitive form: BU conjugted to BI

japanese: お一人さま一つ限りです
english: It's limited to one per customer

japanese: 昨日、一つめこぞうに合った
english: Yesterday, I met a one eyed goblin.
grammar: に: Object of verb - The difference between に and を cannot be defined clearly. However, it is said that if the verb has a nuance of direction or motion, the particle should be に. When it comes to “to meet” and “to kiss”, imaginatively speaking, you would move toward him or her.

japanese: 一人でカラオケに行きました
grammar: で in this context is meansで destinationに verb. I.e. the means in which you verb to destiation.\n Infinitive form: KU conjugated to KI

japanese: 一人はアメリカ人です
むすめは、今日初めて一人でお使いに行きました
english: My daughter did the errands by herself for the first time today
englishlit: Daughter, today first time alone errands went (to go do)
grammar: で in this context is meansで destinationに verb.
